intro: Phaenohoffmannia cajanifolia, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces legume pods that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. The species is adapted to tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
